revised_title: X-ray Analysis of Hair, Wool, and Related Fibers: Molecular Structure and Elastic Properties of Biological Cells
tldr: This article investigates the molecular structure and elastic properties of hair, wool, and related fibers using X-ray studies. The research focuses on the biological cells within the cortex of these fibers, analyzing their composition and behavior. The findings suggest that the cells contain a mix of crystalline and amorphous keratin, and the intercellular material may also have important properties related to the fibers' elasticity.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
